item.title: India is in a position to lead the way in the 21st century
item.description: A new IBM study suggests that the 21st century has the potential to be known as the “Indian century” as India prepares to take a leading role on the global stage. Over half of the executives surveyed believe that better governance and reduced regulation are key to sustained economic growth. Building robust social infrastructure was identified as the second most important factor for economic productivity. Over 40% also highlighted the significance of quality physical infrastructure and a skilled workforce for driving growth.
